column1: dropped. A length ball that nips away, Edwards swings at it and gets a big, healthy outside edge but first slip cups his hands over his head but lets it pop out. Easy as they come
salt in the wounds time.. fuller one, chipped off the pads over mid-on for four
and again, this time he's helped by the angle. Fuller of a length, coming into him, chipped over mid-on with the full face of the bat
back of a length, comes on straight outside off, swing and a miss
short of good length outside off, gets it away to third man off the outside of the bat
shortish, into the hips, jumps and keeps it down towards square leg
good length on middle, very tight, defended to cover
short of a length, some width this time, gets up on his toes and punches between cover and point
another chip from Edwards, but third time isn't the charm apparently. Full and slanted across, sliced towards extra cover where Ashton Agar slides across to his left and snaffles it
short of a length outside off, drops it towards mid-off from the crease for a single
fuller of a length, slanted across off, opens the face to third man for one
slightly shorter this time but similar lines, another run down to third man
short of good length on off, gets on his toes and nudges towards midwicket
fuller outside off, driven back
short of length, pretty wide, drags a pull but the bounce isn't quite there as he gets an under edge that misses the stumps
good length on off, dabs it to the right of mid-on for a quick one
full, angling into the hips, puts the powerful wrists to play as he whips it through midwicket
short of good length outside off, stabbed to deep backward point
comes down the ground and goes inside-out as he carves it away through extra cover
short, angled across off, pulled to deep midwicket

has he taken it, Yeah, he has! Good diving catch. Another chip from the batsman, this time to a fuller one outside off. Henriques looks to go over mid-on but doesn't manage to get underneath that. Willey dives forward and takes it inches from the ground
good length on off, quick dab to point
fuller around middle and leg, pushed back
length on middle, defended towards mid-off
length, angled across off, punched to extra cover
length on off, guides it to the right of point
short of a length, angled in, pulled to the right of deep square
shovelled straight to midwicket. That just had to stick on.. there was no way else he could've got that. Pulled fiercely, with extreme power, and it goes flat and at chest-height to Cartwright
shortish, tries to arch out of the way and cops a blow on the right arm
full, pushed through on off, chipped straight down the ground
short of length, shuffles across towards off and keeps it out down the pitch
short of a length, punched through the gap at extra cover
defends a length ball back
short of length, outside off, gets on top of it and dabs it towards short third man gently
length, curves into him and beats the flick to ping the pad
short of good length on off, defended to backward point
tries to pull but gets zero room and the ball goes from under the bat over middle stump. Keeper fails to gather it
on the toes as he punches to the sweeper at cover
short, pitching outside leg, pulled one-bounce to deep backward square
full, clipped off the pads to deep midwicket
short, pulled to deep backward square
full on middle, pushed to short cover for a casual single.. direct hit could've had him
tucked off the pads to the left of mid-on
fuller, turning away from off, driven to wide long-off
clipped off the pads to square leg
comes down the ground and reaches out to a fuller one and carves it away to deep cover
on a length, backs away and punches to mid-off
full, curving into leg, drilled away through extra cover, sweeper dives to his right and cuts it off just in front
sliding in, drilled down to long-on
punches a length ball to midwicket
pushed across, rocks back and cuts through point
dropped. Agar puts down a simple return chance. Silk pushes back to a length ball but it stops on him and he chips it back as a result. Agar fails to close his hands in time
back of a length, angled across, worked away towards third man
short around off, pulled to deep square leg, midwicket runs across and makes a diving save
back of a length on off, punched off the backfoot, and Cartwright at point flings himself full-length to his right to stop it clean
shortish, makes use of the angle to pull it and beat deep backward square to his left comfortably
short of length, finds point as he punches off the backfoot
floated up on off, driven to sweeper cover
short of length, rocks back and pulls to deep midwicket
comes down the ground and drills it away to cover
fuller of a length, quite slow, driven towards mid-off
gets down and forces a sweep across the line to deep midwicket
pulled away to deep midwicket
length outside off, worked to point with a half-angled bat
tucked off the pads to midwicket
short of good length on off, punched to extra cover
full on middle, driven straight down and long-on gets around it
short and slow outside off, gets on top and slaps it to sweeper cover
slider, backs away and slashes it between cover and point
backs away early and Agar follows him, punched to deep cover
comes down to meet the pitch and shovels it straight over Agar, well to the left of long-off
makes room early and scythes a cut to deep cover off this short one
on the pads, worked away to deep fine leg
tucked off the pads to the right of square leg
swings across the line to pull it to the left of long-on
fails to get entirely on top of this short one and pulls one-bounce to deep midwicket
back of length, slow outside off, punched to deep cover
shortish, angled across, makes room to slap and chips it over the in-field at cover
sliding in, driven away through extra cover
sliding in towards middle and leg, paddled away to deep fine leg
short, backs away and cuts to deep cover
short, outside off, slapped to deep point
sliding into leg, backs away and drives to long-off
comes down the ground and crunches it to long-off
shortish, goes straight outside off, aimlessly swings for a pull and misses
fuller, driven to deep cover
full, slanted across, chipped straight over, past mid-off's right
drills a fuller one straight back to Benrendorff who gets a hand to it before it rolls away to long-on
whipped off the pads between midwicket and long-on
short of length, outside off, chipped away through backward point
yorker outside off, makes no contact as he reaches out for it
pulls this back of a length delivery to midwicket to bring up his fifty
shortish, outside off, gets on top and fetches a pull that goes between deep midwicket and deep backward square converging on the ball
driven to extra cover
yorker around leg, dug out down the ground, wide of long-on and they push back for the second
angles in a yorker towards leg stump, squeezes it out to his left for a single
in the slot and he gets the maximum for it, on a length, angled across, swung across and tonked over midwicket.. fifty for Hughes
bigger and better. Similar room but this one's shorter than the last and it's pulled over deep midwicket. Further into the crowd
full, pushed across, chipped one-bounce to long-off
full toss on middle, shovelled between deep midwicket and long-on
full toss, sliding towards leg, worked away to deep backward square

short, backs away and slaps it over the in-field.. might've been a collision as two fielders give it chase at the extra cover boundary. Ah, a narrow escape. All good in the end and the ball's pulled back too
makes room and chops a cut towards cover
low full toss, drilled away to deep cover
too full, leg-stump lines, beats the clip and pings the pad. They steal a leg bye and beat the bowler charging forward and having a shy
short of length, slow, pulled to deep backward square
yorker, squeezed out towards square leg
pushes across a knuckle ball, swings across the line and beaten
short of a length, slower, swings at it but doesn't get enough meat on the shot as the ball dies down towards long-on who bends forward and snaffles it. End of a monumental stand
walks across to a full toss and shovels it down to long-on one-bounce
down and across to a full toss and paddled over the keeper's outstretched right hand
full, dipping, wide outside off, beaten
good length outside off, gets down on one knee and smokes it over deep midwicket with a big slog

oh, tame! That was so easy. He's given it away first ball. Length ball, slid across, Whiteman advances, expecting the ball to spin into him but it goes on straight with the angle and beats the outside edge for Phillipe to complete a straightforward stumping
full on leg, nudged into the on side
slid across off, goes off the inside edge into the on side as he presses forward to defend
tucked off the backfoot to midwicket
slider on middle, blocked into the on side
slides down leg and the keeper whips the bails off.. no damage done
back of a length, a bit of turn away, chops a cut to point
length around off, defended off the outside of the bat towards point
full outside off, defended back
on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
full on leg, clipped to mid-on
runs it away to third man with an open face
short of a length on middle, whipped away to backward square leg
full on middle, nudged back towards the bowler
length outside off, strides forward and punches to cover

great, great catch at the boundary! Willey comes down the ground and goes big straight down the ground. Doesn't get as much of the bat behind it as he would've liked and Joe Denly at long-on sprints to his right and slides across the turn to snaffle it just in front
full on middle, turned away to square leg
looped up on off, driven to wide long-on
looks plumb and given. O'Keefe turning the heat on the Scorchers. Closes the face to one that drifts in subtly, but the ball straightens, beats the inside edge and pins him in front of middle and leg
full, angling into him, clipped aerially, just to the left of short midwicket
length on middle, driven to mid-on
short of good length on off, defended in front of cover for a quick one
short of a length on middle, pulled to midwicket
back of a length outside off, punched towards backward point with an open face
good length on off, punched to mid-off
comes down the track to the pitch and drills it to long-on
short of a length on off, minimal turn, backfoot punch through the covers
curving into off, driven back
keeps low but he manages to work it down to long-on
length ball, sliding down leg side
shortish on off, backs away and cuts to point
full, angled across, swings and misses
short, angled across off, gets on top of it and punches to point
good length outside off, gets behind it and defends
short of a length, pitched outside leg, tries to flick and wears it on the pad
back of a length, pushed across, chops a punch towards point
shuffles across to this short of a length delivery and heaves it away to deep backward square
full around off, driven down to long-on
slower length ball, tucked behind square leg
short and wide, cut to point
back of a length, angling in, tucked to square leg
slower short ball, lets it come on and pulls to deep midwicket
short of good length outside off, punched to point
slides into him, backs away and punches to cover
flat, short of a length, pulled to deep midwicket
rushes down the track like he's going to hit the bowler or something and then pushes it straight back before having to scamper back. Very nearly managed to make himself look very bad
cuts from very close to off, no room to free the arms and he chops it into the surface
shortish outside off, punched late through backward point
short of good length on off, stabbed to point
length ball, angling in, backs away and tucks it behind square
short and wide, too easy, opens up and sends it crashing through point
length on middle, tucked towards deep midwicket
backs away to a short one but doesn't manage to get on top of the bounce. Pulls but straight into the pitch and then rushes through for a single as the bowler runs towards the ball
back of a length, spins away outside off, cut late through point
gets down to sweep but the ball's not full enough and pitches in front. He misses but it also keeps low and the keeper fluffs it
sliding in with the arm towards middle, backs away and carves a punch away towards point
short, drifting down leg, latches onto it early and pulls it well over deep square leg. Gives it a good whack
shortish, straightens around off, backs away and curs to point
on a length, nudged into the gap at midwicket
clipped off the pads to square leg
sliding onto middle, backs away and carves it away to cover
down the ground and clipped to deep midwicket
comes down the ground and whips it powerfully to deep midwicket
lots of flight and dipping on middle, drilled down to long-on
back of a length, pace off, swings and misses
length, angled across, slashed through backward point
full, pushed too far across, called a wide
yorker on middle, dug out past a diving short cover
walks across and scoops this length ball fine
slices a fuller one through backward point, the sweeper cuts it off
pitched up outside off, crunched to a diving extra cover
sprays it too far down leg, past the keeper shuffling to his left
short and spinning away, cut to deep point
down the ground and chipped off the toe-end one-bounce to long-off
short of length, presents a half-angled bat outside off and inside-edges to the pad
swept hard to deep backward square
drilled to the right of O'Keefe off the inside of the bat
short, walks across and whips it over the fine leg region
down on one knee to whip it but it's not full enough and he gets a top-edge that drops short of deep square leg
full outside off, driven in front of extra cover and beats a direct hit on the single
floats it up on middle and leg, down the ground to slap it straight to the boundary
now he puts the wrists to use to whip this through the gap between deep midwicket and long-on
length outside off, shovelled through midwicket.. game on!
yorker, pins the front boot but the impact may have been outside
tries to pull a short one and drags it down to long-off
angles down leg
straight to point. Gets up on the toes to a short one and swipes at it but the ball sails flat and straight into the hands of debutant Edwards
length outside off, opens the face to short third man
short, wide, cut past extra cover but Denly sprints to his left from long-on and dives to pull it back
full outside off, creamed away to deep cover
full outside off, driven to deep cover
very full, curving into off, drilled to long-off
tries to flick but misses as the ball pings the back pad
fuller ball, drifts back in in the air and then further after pitching to beat the closing face of the bat and ping the pad before deflecting onto the stumps
back of a length, pitching outside leg, tucked to square leg

oh, what a catch! Hughes pulls off a stunner at short midwicket. This was a shortish delivery outside off, giving him room to free up and pull. Hughes jumps with the right hand outstretched, doesn't manage to hold on, but as the ball drops down to his left, holds on with his left hand out on the second attempt
short again, flays a pull to deep midwicket
yorker on off, dug out past the bowler's right.. fifty for Cartwright
slower short ball, left alone outside off
short of length outside off, slapped down to long-on for a brace
slower ball, swings and misses as the ball goes over middle stump
short of good length, outside off, drags a pull wide of long-on
yorker, jams the bat down just in the nick of time to get an inside edge.. that was heading straight for middle stump

full toss, slapped to deep point. No-ball called but there could be a run out here. Cartwright pushes back for the second. Dicey. Leans forward and stretches and even the drag of the bat can't save him
full, nips away outside off, reaches out and chips it over mid-off
punches a full toss to extra cover
full toss on off, carved away to point
pulls with no room and gets a top edge down to long-on
short of length, pulled to deep midwicket
backs away to a short one and slaps it to long-off
shortish outside off, pulls off the bottom half of the bat to deep square leg
short, no room, swings looking for a pull and gets a top-edge that the keeper settles under
short around off, backs away and carves it to deep cover
back of a length, slower, from the back of the hand, keeps low and he swings and misses
yorker outside off, jams the bat down but gets beaten
slower short ball, swivels and pulls to deep square leg where Edwards lets it go through the legs as he dives
walks across to a fuller one and gets hit on the pad outside the line of off stump
low full toss, smashes it straight into the stumps. Curran has his hand out but has it grazed the fingers?
swings wildly at a fuller one and gets an inside edge to fine leg
